concepts.sumo_definition: Permanent structures designed for human occupancy, work, or specific activities.
concepts.definition: Permanent structures designed for human occupancy, work, or specific activities.

positive_examples: The new office building downtown has thirty floors.
They converted the old factory into luxury apartments.
The casino was packed with tourists trying their luck.
Scientists worked late in the research laboratory.
The dance hall echoed with music from the 1940s band.
Security was tight around the military installation.
negative_examples: The bridge spans the entire river valley.
We parked under the concrete overpass during the storm.
The ancient statue stood in the center of the plaza.
The submarine docked at the naval pier.
Construction crews erected scaffolding around the monument.
The oil rig operated twenty miles offshore.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Infrastructure, Monument, Vehicle, Equipment

concepts.definition: Knowledge domain encompassing artifacts, technology, systems, tools, and human-made constructs
Knowledge domain encompassing data, representations, propositions, relations, and abstract entities
Knowledge domain encompassing organisms, biological processes, ecosystems, and life
Knowledge domain encompassing cognition, agency, social structures, communication, and mental processes

concepts.sumo_definition: Geographic areas formed by natural processes rather than human activity, including landforms, water bodies, and ecosystems.
concepts.definition: Geographic areas formed by natural processes rather than human activity, including landforms, water bodies, and ecosystems.

positive_examples: The Amazon rainforest ecosystem spans across nine countries in South America.
The Great Lakes region contains the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.
The Pacific Ocean covers about one-third of the Earth's surface.
The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world.
The Rocky Mountains stretch from Canada to New Mexico.
The coral reefs of the Caribbean form a diverse marine ecosystem.
negative_examples: The state of California has a population of nearly 40 million people.
The downtown business district contains many skyscrapers.
The subway system connects all five boroughs of the city.
The agricultural zone produces wheat and corn for export.
The industrial park houses several manufacturing facilities.
The residential neighborhood has tree-lined streets and parks.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: UrbanArea, PoliticalTerritory, AdministrativeRegion, EconomicZone, CulturalRegion

concepts.definition: Knowledge domain encompassing matter, energy, forces, physical quantities, and natural phenomena

concepts.sumo_definition: Human activities and behaviors involving interaction, work, recreation, and spiritual practices within society.
concepts.definition: Human activities and behaviors involving interaction, work, recreation, and spiritual practices within society.

positive_examples: She joined a book club to meet new people in her neighborhood.
The team worked together to complete the project on deadline.
They went hiking as a family bonding activity on weekends.
The community gathered at the temple for evening prayers.
He volunteered at the local food bank every Saturday morning.
The children played soccer together in the park after school.
negative_examples: The plant grew taller in the sunlight each day.
Her heart rate increased during the medical examination.
The bacteria multiplied rapidly in the petri dish.
The lion hunted alone across the savanna at dawn.
Photosynthesis converts carbon dioxide into oxygen in leaves.
The injured bird's wing healed naturally over several weeks.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BiologicalProcesses, AnimalBehavior, PlantLife, HealthAndMedicine
